meanings.definition: To leave or go away abruptly or rudely.
meanings.sent1: I told him to fuckoff after he kept bothering me.
meanings.sent2: She decided to fuckoff from the party early.
meanings.sent3: When the annoying salesman wouldn't stop talking, I finally had to tell him to fuckoff.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to fuckoff as the storm passed by.
meanings.sent5: The cat didn't like the loud noise and quickly tried to fuckoff to a quieter spot.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of anger or dismissal.
meanings.sent1: Fuckoff! I can't believe you would say that.
meanings.sent2: When he heard the news, he just shouted, 'Fuckoff!'
meanings.sent3: After tripping over the same rock for the third time, he yelled, 'Fuckoff!'
meanings.sent4: The loud alarm blared, making everyone in the room want to shout, 'Fuckoff!'
meanings.sent5: As the car splashed muddy water on her, she couldn't help but scream, 'Fuckoff!'
